newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dead warcrimes suspect not on Tribunal wanted list.
newsitem.headline: Dead warcrimes suspect not on Tribunal wanted list.

text.p: The U.N. War Crimes Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia said on Thursday a Bosnian Serb police chief killed in a clash with NATO-led peacekeeping forces was not on their published list of indicted war criminals.
"His name is not on our published list," Tribunal spokesman Christian Chartier said.
British officials have confirmed that Simo Drljaca was killed in the northwestern Bosnian town of Prijedor during an operation early on Thursday to arrest him on war crimes charges.

The Tribunal has disclosed indictments against 76 suspects so far, but last month its investigators made a surprise arrest of the former Serb mayor of Vukovar, Slavko Dokmanovic, whose indictment had never been made public.
Tribunal chief prosecutor Louise Arbour said at the time she planned a change of strategy, keeping indictments secret in future, to raise the chance of arresting more suspects.
Chartier would not say whether an indictment had been issued against Drljaca but kept under wraps.
